channel.title: Network hard drive
channel.description:
Okay so I'm looking to buy a network hard drive, the contents I want only to be shared between my laptop, and my desktop computer. I would like the documents to be stored on it, so they can be accessed simultaneously with both PCs. (kinda like the school/college systems, where your files can be accessed on any computer)
Preferably with a storage capacity of 1TB or 1.5TB (if they exist?)
Just looking for some recommendations really, cheers.

item.title: Network hard drive
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:366635”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=462836.msg3386690#msg3386690 date=1288522172]
i’d actually recommend buying a prebuilt nas rather than building your own, since your requirements are presumably not that high and power consumption/size/space will be better

something like http://www.ebuyer.com/product/184896 though im not recommending that product as i dont have experience with it

they don’t come with drives generally, btw
[/quote]

Thanks for that, however I’ve decided to just go with the cheapest external hard drive I could find for now due to my small budget :P.
But obviously I could later buy that and adapt it into a network hard drive if needed, but I needed an urgent backup as my laptop died on me.

I would use Linux and share with samba, but I’m pretty sure Linux doesn’t support the 3d modelling programs (and photoshop) that I use on an everyday basis, and I would like these to be usable on both machines as I want to combine the processing power into a small render farm.

Thanks for the advice guys.[/quote]

I suppose you could also share with the windows ‘share’ option also, both that and samba both use the ‘cifs’ file system.
